physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man in a military uniform riding in a rickshaw with the rickshaw-puller posed on the right. The rickshaw-puller is wearing a hat, long sleeved jacket and shorts. Behind the rickshaw, there is a row of building structures. There are no tears or folds seen on the photographs.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Gen Shipp, complete with Rickshaw and grinning puller, Johore Barru Singapore 1941
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
